Entry.1:
– Bir – Hod Amara

Get a letter writing spasm & start writing to all and sundry. Getting quite cool at dusk now,
Entry.2: cool day. Rumours of move farther out.
Entry.3: Taube visits us and after flying around for some time left us for bombed rail head but doing no damage.
Entry.4: Receive orders for pack up and leave Amara. 10pm Sturman after a dog with his revolver. Midnight on watch.
Entry.5:
4 am close down and burn down the dugouts by the aid of the moon. 9.30 leave for Ge’eila 5 m south east of Salmana. Have a painful ride of about five miles only and taking till 4 p.m. to do so simply because we had

to attach ourselves to the rear of a camel transport column. On arrival and on climbing a sand drift the camels get mixed up a bit sending one of the loads to the bottom of the drift. Pick a good site and have a bit of tea. Erect station and erect mess hut. Work up till 9 pm by aid of moonlight and turn in.
Entry.6:
Owing to argument I arrange to change George Hamilton places, he to take my watch and I am to 

cook the meals. George having very sore hands also aids the agreement especially so as I am sick of watches although I may turn it in yet. Spend the day in making dugouts. Arthur & Missen return to Amara to dig up and return with the tables & wood we had buried on leaving, in case we could go back. Sturman doesn’t want chow food (rice) for tea & there is nothing else so I put the motion as follows: one man one vote, no three course meals, don’t like don’t eat. Any complaints ask for better rations or appoint another cook thereby covering myself very fairly from all attacks such as a cook generally receives. Get christened Greasy Smacker.
Entry.7: Have a visit from Taube whilst cooking breakfast, which passes over very high. When over Hassaniya he dropped three bombs which, although about four or five miles away could be heard sighing as they dropped. They landed on the 126th Brigade causing a few casualties. Anti aircraft get in some good shooting but as usual, the Hun gets off scot free. Our planes busy during the morning dropping a few on El Arish in payment for those we got.
Entry.8: Scrap going on down on the Maghara Mountains where 800 Turks and 4 guns are concentrated. Hear heavy gunfire all day.
Entry.9:
Taube visits us but is driven away by guns at Bir-el-Abd. Shell cases and 

shrapnel falling all around us. Camel’s hump blown off by one case.
Entry.10: Heavy fogs now the order of the day and wet nights.
Entry.12: Taube over again with bombs but driven away before he could drop them. Shell cases & shrapnel thickly falling.
Entry.13: Taube over again but leaves before getting near to us.
Entry.15: Taube over again but keeping well away from Bir-el-Abd and guns. Shurman leaves WA4 to take charge of C troop whilst Cpt Downing is sick, he having collided with a ferry in Cairo whilst on leave.
Entry.16: Taube over again but driven off over el Abd
Entry.17: 3rd Brigade relieved by N.Z’s. More rows over cooking so threw it in, leaving some of the more experienced heads to do it, they professing to be able to do better on what we get.
Entry.18: Trickett and Kiernan go to Bir-el-Abd for stores. Taube over again, coming in by the sea. Blaze away at him and we nearly get an empty shell case.
Entry.19: Go to Bir el Abd with Missen for mail.
Entry.20:
Pack up and leave Hod Ge’eila at 8 am burying the tables & other gear. Travel across country and arrive Bir Mosefigat 2 pm and erect on big sand hill 

overlooking the N.Z’s camp. Away over towards the sea can be seen the edges and part of the huge salt lake Sabket Bardwil a brilliant white colour and along the edge runs the railway which is being pushed on as fast as possible.
Entry.21: Take the set down for necessary repairs and make it very clean. All new gear as far as possible used. Play five hundred after tea and have great amusement.
Entry.22: Taube over again, drops a bomb near railhead and 3 others on Salmana.
Entry.23: Taube over again. Anti-aircraft guns blazing at him from Salmana lob a few "overs" near us which explode in the sand, the time fuse not acting.
Entry.25: Feel a bit seedy same as on
Entry.28: Go to AMC NZ MR and get fixed up.
Entry.29: Some rain falls during early morning. Feel well. Five hundred in wireless tent and roars of laughter
Entry.30: Feeling very seedy indeed. Taubes over who chases one of our BE planes
Entry.31: Go to AMC again and get sent to Salmana in red cross van. Spend the night in English hospital.
Entry.32:
Take train to Kantara to be put in isolation. Tonsilitis. Have a dreary ride and go to 26th. Casualty Clearing Station – English 

hospital where I am suspected of having diphtheria. Only milk "swallowable"
Entry.33:
The procedure with likely diphtheria cases is to take a swab of the throat, incubate it and place under the microscope and by the result is known the treatment required. Put into B5 ward and given a cup of milk and big piece of bread and jam as if one could face that. A great dodge of the orderlies then is to procure some equally uneatable article such as a chicken and when you leave it as they know you will, they have it. Get 4000 units of anti-toxin serum injected into my chest with a rusty needle by the feelings. Positively stated to have diphtheria – yet feel fair. 

10/11/16

Taken down to Anglo American Nile Coys Hospital steamer NIAGARA and steam down the canal to Port Said and jammed straight into the observation ward. No medicine or gargles yet. Given a blue coat, blue trousers, red tie etc etc and clean (?) shirt and sox and put amongst a lot of Tommies. Bread and jam for tea. Cocoa for supper. Few ALH men in the ward thank goodness.
Entry.34: Feel splendid and fit for anything. Porridge and bread and jam for breakfast.
Entry.35: Have 3 good square feeds and a few swims.
Entry.36:
Go for walk to end of 

the eastern breakwater after tea. Supper every night at 7.30.
Entry.37: Swimming during the morning and sleep all afternoon
Entry.40:
sleep and arguments all day. Sister Atkinson sings Australia will be there-er-er-er.

Up to
Entry.41:
11/16
 Having good time walks along the breakwater and cards all day.
Entry.43: blow comes – leave hospital for Details Port Said or rather Anzac Rest Camp. Parade round Port Said and go to pictures.
Entry.44: Receive 10/- and go on the bust meet Ahzeen and later on Mr Lowder missionary who takes us round to his house.
Entry.46: Round Port Said and over to see Sister Atkinson at the hospital.
Entry.47: Leave Anzac Rest Camp for Kantara 2nd LH details. Arrive 2 pm and find some of the Sig Sqn boys guard over stores.
Entry.49: Leave Kantara 4 pm for Mazar arriving midnight being met by George Hamilton and Trickett.
Entry.50: Take watch on long wave set with Sturman and receive press from Vienna (OSM) wireless.
Entry.51: Visit Eric & Hopkins and during late afternoon Taube pays a visit. Lads "merry after tea
Entry.52: Tidy up station and receive press from Malta – (SD)
Entry.53: Taube over and blazed at by anti aircraft like fury.
Entry.54:
Leave Mazar for Mustagedda and Arnussi and then to 

Garrarat on Stunt to see how the operations would pan out. Pass Abu Gilban’s tomb and on the way home Taube drops small bomb on us, landing about 200 yds away. Receive lovely parcel from home.
Entry.55: Pay £5. Taube over again but only one shot fired.
Entry.56: Taube over again and deliberately leaves and returns. Perfect hail of shells at him. Our planes give chase and our guns line him as he rises. Engineers blow up a well at dusk.
Entry.58: Go to Malha to W3 which is in need of repairs. Borrow a horse for same. Taube bombs Mazar
Entry.59: Reveille to the tune of 2 Taubes who bomb Mazar dropping 14 in a ring round us. YMCA blown to atoms. Prepare to leave.
Entry.60: Reveille 4am and pack up station. Noon leave for unknown destination. Leave W2 a few miles out and go on our own. Pick up transport column and go ahead. Pass infantry resting between the hills. Desert dotted with thousands of fires where the troops are having an hour’s rest. Later on we catch up with the NZ’s and learn that we are to attack El Arish at dawn.
Entry.61:
Thousands of mounted men are to be seen here boiling billies and having 

a rest. Horses are fed and watered and we push on. Very cold too. Natives have to walk all the way. Dark and dreary as we push on all the night. Daybreak we are cold to the bone and tired. At 8 am we arrive at and shelter behind El Arish. Aeroplane reports all clear and troops approach but do not enter. Turks have evacuated El Arish. We rest our camels & have a sleep to be awakened by a Taube & bombs. Later on we pitch our station on a hill overlooking El Arish. Masmai. Do 8 to 12 shift.
Entry.62: Taube over again. Four men killed by a trip mine in El Arish. 4 pm orders to move. 5 pm leave Masmai and set out for El Arish arriving at 8 pm.
Entry.63:
Leave El Arish at 1 am after rationing and travel all night. Thousands & thousands of mounted men, guns, and camel corps pass in endless masses as we travel along the old Wadi El Arish. At daybreak we are numb with cold. Arrive at place 7 miles from Magdarah where all units meet. On the order the troops branch off. Meet Chas. Cosner in Ambulance stretcher having an easy ride. Glorious sight to see all the troops dashing into action. We follow 

the N.Z.’s and erect on top of a hill overlooking the place of attack. Battery of artillery (Somersets) set up alongside and the battle begins. Guns blaze all day and from this hill we can see the Turks and our men fighting at the foot of the great gaunt hills. The enemy artillery very poor. Somersets sight an enemy gun and blow it to atoms. Our planes bomb the enemy redoubts and trenches. Great sight to see. 4 pm Turks surrender and we tag over 1000 prisoners and only lose a few men. 6 pm set out for home owing to no water. Feeling very very dry and thirsty. Travel all night.
Entry.64: Great sight to see the troops returning along the road. Wadi El Arish. White with dust and singing songs. Guns look as if covered with snow. Arrived LAFAN 9 pm with W2 station and boil a billy. Turn in till transport arrives at 2 am. Proceed and get lost turning in till 5am and daylight and then return to MASMI. Absolutely done up. Taubes (2) bomb El Arish.
Entry.65: Cold bleak day. Receive an Xmas pudding for tea. Rain like blazes all night. Wet to the skin.
Entry.66: Raining like blazes and dugout washed away again. Spend a joyful night in the wet.
Entry.67:
Receive orders to leave 

Bir Abuzekari

Masmi for the beach near El Arish. Arrive here 3 pm & erect. Being a rest camp we only work from 6.30 am to 9 am. Raining again. Build a bivvy and get wet again.
Entry.68: Raining all night, wet to the skin. Go to El Arish & W2 wireless. Sturman puts an end to the rest & our station in keeping with his usual mean spirited ways. Feen gets wolfed by him & in return reports to the Major. Raining all afternoon like blazes.
Entry.69: Raining still and got a lovely cold.
Entry.70:
Go into El Arish to buy eggs. Mahomet – our camel driver the barneying. We secure 11 eggs for 15 Pt. Raining like blazes with cold wind. Go to W2 and Squadron. Shipwreck on the beach. Naval trawler F4 in trouble being right ashore. Tommies as usual turn El Arish into a yard with barbed wire. Heavy sea running.

31/1216

Cold but bright day. Go for a swim but found water too cold. Rum issue New Years Eve.
Entry.71: New Year’s Day. Move from Bir ZEKari to Kilo 139 railhead dump. Three taubes bomb K139. 10 bombs. Blowing like Hell.
Entry.72: Blowing furiously everything covered in sand. Rotten day, cramped up in the tent
Entry.74: Move to El Arish–Birzekari and erect again. Cold day and very bleak.
Entry.75: Sun actually shines all day. Heated arguments over cooking in which AEH shows his point to his disadvantage by falling in the estimation of others. Missen recalled. Apply for transfer to R.F.C.
Entry.76: Bright day. Missen called to W2 leaving us short handed. Taube over.
Entry.77:
Two Taubes bomb rail head & kill 26 natives & wound 38, Harold Menzies visits me. Taubes come over at 9.15 
pm
 and bomb the El Arish Wadi, thinking that the troops were on their way out to Rafa as had been arranged but cancelled later. Taubes use their machine guns & drop 25 bombs, it being bright full moon. Not one hit. Anti aircraft guns try to hit him.
Entry.78: Leave Zekari for W2. Taube over and turned away. W2 leave for Rafa on horses taking a pack set and a trench set.
Entry.79: Taube bombs El Arish with 5 bombs.
Entry.80: W2 returns, trench set broken by horse knocking key off.
Entry.82: Go to El Arish Wadi to see the Rafa Prisoners. Two Taubes bomb Arish during the afternoon.
Entry.83: Two Taubes over but kept well off
Entry.84: Hostile planes over but kept well back by anti guns. Mail day
Entry.85: Go for a swim and find it very cold. Turkish mine exploded by gunfire.
Entry.87: Leave to Cairo to be granted. Great fuss over the rum issue. We are supposed to line up & drink it before an officer because someone gave some to some natives & got them drunk. All refuse to line up.
Entry.92: Orders to move, but Capt squares division.
Entry.96:
Bombed by two Taubes bombs dropping within 100 yds of Station. 5 horses killed in a small Tommy section passing. Cut a hole through for mast. 

1-2-3-4

Nothing doing. Lot of dust blowing about and being bright moonlight all are dwelling on a night raid. Tanks arrive Mazar – Pom Pom guns on armoured train.
Entry.97: Take out trench sets & lose temper over camels which play up considerably
Entry.98: Go for a walk through El Arish taking photos. Visit the old fort alongside the mosque. This old fort has been shelled to a mere heap of stones from the sea by monitors & not a brick has been misplaced around the outside. Remark accuracy in gunnery. This fort commands a wide view. Much talk about peace.
Entry.99: Photos and making small long wave set.
Entry.100:
Out on Wadi El Arish with W7 trench Wireless set. 

10-2-17 

Rumours of a move to take place. Lads play 3rd Brigade football.
Entry.101: Brigade move to Hassamya. W5 arrive from Bayud. Go to lecture on Australia in YMCA at night.
Entry.102:
12/2/ 

Stormy night with vivid lightning & rain. Taube over.
Entry.104: Rainy & cloudy day breaking in more camels.
Entry.108: Out with trench set all day on new camels. Hostile passes over very low.
Entry.111: W3 & W5 leave El Arish for El Berf with all camels and gear. Go for a swim in morning – 12-4 pm watch on W.2. 22 – Leave El Arish at 8 am and meet at rendezvous on Wadi. Taube over as if by arrangement. Arrive El Berf at 1 pm and leave at 2 pm. We are followed by the Intelligence Dept consisting of a Captain (Gipps) S/M Bedouin and several bedouin men who are spies & police. Arrive Sheik Zowayid at 5.36 pm. Beautiful sunset over the great flats & swamp.
Entry.112: Lie about all day. 3rd Bde. & N.Z.’s return from reconnaissance having met with Turks.
Entry.114:
am watch. Taube over during morning. Make human arrow for our plane. Take cooking instead of going to El Berf for W3. 

W3 arrive tea time.
Entry.115:
Midnight to 2 am shift. Printing photos all day. Bedouins arrive with goats & donks & camels having been taken prisoners. 
Mail & surprise
Entry.116:
Move over to the beach and bring the long wave gear to the site of the ancient Grecian ornithological church. 

27-28 

and on to
Entry.117: erecting & preparing for the others to come.
Entry.118: Hooker arrives back from the hospital.
Entry.121: Gales of wind blowing. Two hostiles over towards evening.
Entry.122:
Leave Clay Bluff at 9 am for Bir Shunnar arriving midday

12-/3

On watch 4 to 8 am – Two hostiles over

13/3/- W3 leaves for Rafa. Bill Cole leaves for A.M.C.
Entry.123: Squadron have horse races. Testing gelignite on the beach.
Entry.124: Go to rafa with trench set & new methods which turn out a failure.
Entry.125:
out again on sets. Taubes quite game hovering over. 

18= 

Print all day & surf.
Entry.126: Playing about with trench sets all day.
Entry.127: Go to Khan Yunus playing with trench sets.
Entry.128:
to 12 to 4 am watch. Leave Bir Shunnar 9 am for NZ’s – the great stunt. Westwood from W3 remains as operator. Three days rations issued and orders to "live on the country ahead if necessary. Promises of Stoush. 

All troops to be in it.
Entry.129: Westwood and Pierce leave as Frost & Missen arrive.
Entry.130:
Band playing down on beach when word received to leave Orzo 25th – 

25th

leave Orzo for Bir Zela arriving at 9 am. A lovely little place with inland lake and view over the sea. Green grass and flowers everywhere. Misso and I spend the day in the village looking for eggs. Leave again 0200
Entry.131:
following up two infantry divisions, artillery of 
765
 60 pdrs 18 pdrs 4.5 howitzers & 8 in howitzers. About 60 thousand troops march on Gaza. We, - LH – swing around so as to avoid the infantry who attacked along the beach. Heavy fog drops & delays us. About 7 am fog lifts & we move ahead. Man outed by vicious horse. Taubes down low & one fires his machine gun on us bullets being very close. Very hot days. Swing around Gaza about 9 am and receive salvo of HES from Gaza which give us the wink to move. Our planes bomb but otherwise all quiet. Move into position 3 pm. Raid Bedouin’s oranges. AMD and artillery open fire and advance on the redouts being met with furious fire. Shells flying in scores. 4pm more artillery & more men 

* Robbing the Bedouins of oranges because they refused to sell them.*

drawn in. 5 pm Armoured cars drawn in. Amuse ourselves by VKS wireless in Gaza. Big KrUPP gun near Beersheba sending over HE’S and trying to find our 8 in howitzers. Taube spotting by wireless for him. HEs shows make a great noise. Taube fired at by MG and rifle fire. 6 PM. All artillery in and a hell fire too. Turkish redoubts blown to hell. 8000 reinforcements set out from SIMSUR towards us. 

*Sunday night the infantry singing hymns.*

A battery 6th LH & NZs meet them. In the twilight on can see the flash from guns & hear the rumble of the HE’S on the redoubts. All redoubts give in except the main one. NZ’S and 2nd have street fighting in Gaza. 6.30 PM dismantle and 7 PM leave & try to pick up cable to follow back to Beila. A dreary trip. Pass the reinforcements mentioned and the armoured cars. Practically lost so turn in alongside a Tommy outpost absolutely done up. Hit the pillow & finish.
Entry.132: Awakened at 6 am by General Royston who with
Entry.133:
Bde were leaving – having been forced to retire. Furious firing near 

by. All speed made, whilst a squadron fight a rear guard action to enable us to get out. Turks advance. Furious riding. Pass one of our planes that had hit the earth & smashed. The Pilot burns it as we pass. Turks open on us with shrapnel. Thousands of mounted troops galloping away to the tune of shrapnel. Great excitement. Arrived Beila 9 am with camels done. Fresh troops leave and artillery replenish limbers. Great bombarding of Gaza by 8in howitzers. No water in camp. Trench sets return done up. Continual coughing of howitzers all day. Planes very busy spotting. Prepare to leave again. Infantry remained in position all night and held Turks. Monitor busy lobbing HE’S in during evening. Erect station 6 PM but do not keep watch.
Entry.134: Dismantle 9 am and move to beach. Go for swim and see transports unloading guarded by monitors.
Entry.135: All quiet – go for swims all the afternoon – mail arrives
Entry.136:
Move over
Move over to HQ position and do not erect. At tea we shell a Turkish working party at Gaza.
Entry.137: Jacko shells us during morning. Lovely surf in morning
Entry.139: Still shelling. Chandler & I leave 9 am for Rafa for goods. Pass through KHAN-YUNUS. Busy little market place here. Take photos and have look round. Arrive Rafa 4 PM and bivouac with some 52nd Division A.S.C. men. Go to Flying Corps & see a number of photos of Turkish positions.
Entry.140: Leave 9 am for Bela arriving 4 PM. Seven of our planes up for a Taube – no good.
Entry.141: Go down to Bela & see the tanks. Tiger-Kia-Ora. Pincher Sir Archibald, Knutly and three others – 8 in all. Male tanks carry two 6lb guns & female 4 maxim and smaller arms.
Entry.144:
Jacko shells railhead & busts up things. Blows away half the Clearing Station. 

*See the tanks go out 10 PM.*
Entry.145: Shells camel corps & wings our 60 pdr of 90th batter. Stunt on
Entry.147: 0400 on watch. 0545 plane goes up & sends Jobb 6. Spotting for M21 X M 31. standing off Bela. Heavy bombardment begins. W18 relaying the spotting from the plane. Go for swim & watch the monitors shelling. Go for another swim during the afternoon with Missen & watch the cruisers & monitors. Shell the redoubt. Salvos end after tea.
Entry.149: Very heavy bombarding. Continual roll like thunder.
Entry.150: War still continues pack up & leave for Squadron leaving W2. Hun submarine fires two torpedoes at cruiser one of which lands high & dry on beach.
Entry.151: Up 4 am & down for the mules 136 arriving. Great fun on the way back to camp.
Entry.152: Heavy sea running. Get thrown 4 times.
Entry.153:
– 

Bombardment continues. Mules give trouble by breaking away. 

24-25-26-27

 Go to Khan Yunus for 9 reinforcements and W1. A dirty hot day. Taubes cause great trouble over bombs. Two brought down.
Entry.154: Go on cooking in place of mules. 17 reinforcements arrive.
Entry.158: PM another night air raid causes great excitement.
Entry.160: Go for railway sleepers for firewood. Reinforcements growling about hard times.
Entry.161: Another night air raid on hospital again, setting fire to the dispensary.
Entry.162: Another air raid & a second lot at 2 am.
Entry.163: Dropping them at the monitor Ladybird.
Entry.164: Finished cooking & made a 2nd Cpt C troop.
Entry.165: Begin NCO’S work with the water parade.
Entry.169: Hell of a day. Sand dust and heat. Half buried in dugout.
Entry.170: awake half buried. Have to dig out.
Entry.171: Heavy sea & calm day. of a move.
Entry.172: Orderly N.C.O. Prepare to move. Dirty Dick (Hun) appears again low down.
Entry.173: Leave 3am for El Farra. Taylor gets thrown & I have to go back for ambulance. 5, 3rd FA cannot receive him unless chits are obtained so go to 2nd L.H. Bde. Simper & 5 proceed to El Abu Sitta & thence to Shellal & on to Farra. Get thrown from mule and have job to locate camp. Arrive camp 6 pm
Entry.174: Take charge water parade. Squadron arrives.
Entry.175: On water parade – 2 miles to Wadi & 2 miles back. Excellent shooting by anti guns. In charge of picquet & have a busy time.
Entry.176:
Leave Farra for new camp, Abasan-el-Kabeer. Lot of talk about 

leave. Fight between two De Havlin scouts and Jacko. Jacko wins again.
Entry.177:
Hot and very dusty.

30/31st/1st June

nothing doing. Di Havlan scouts daily dwell on Jacko but with no success. Pay tonight & talk of leave.
Entry.179: Mail arrives. Issued with new HV Rifles.
Entry.180:
Wagon guard.

8/

Down to beach for swim
Entry.181: Someone pinches major’s polishing rags so camp to be under Discipline – what this means we do not know as there is all the Discipline available now in force.
Entry.182: Fierce bombardment after dark results in capture of Beach Post & 36 turks
Entry.183:
Dirty Day. Take over job

12-13-14-15-16-17th 

Church service in lines and lecture by Col Maitland Woods on one of the ancient ruins of Greek church at Shellal that was one of the first Christian Churches.
Entry.184: 4PM five D Havlans attack an Albatross and bring him down in Wadi Imleih in no man’s land.
Entry.185:
to 

nothing doing. Bro C troop consisting of A troop and W5 leave for Desert Column
Entry.186: Plenty of work – 5 men and 43 animals.
Entry.187:
– 

Slip for leave -

27/28/29 30

nil –

1/st 

Opportunity of leave. Leave Khan Yunus in truck arrive Kantara 6.30 am
Entry.188: Arrive Cairo 2 PM and go to Hotel Metropole and kit stores. Get new suit.
Entry.189: Mess about in morn and use afternoon in motor to the nile delta barrage.
Entry.190:
To Cheops 
and
 in morn & Matarieh in afternoon
Entry.191: To Citadel morn & bazaars with Said in afternoon.
Entry.192: Leave Cairo 11 am and arrive Kantara 4 pm. Leave 6 pm and arrive Rafa 6 am
Entry.193: after awful night in a crowded truck. Leave Rafa 11.45 for wadi Shiek Nuram and arrive camp 5 PM.
Entry.195:
Parade to major over sig instructors job at Zeitoun.

11-12th
Entry.197:
Lecture on Palestine by Col Maitland Woods. 

15-16-17-18 

nil.
Entry.198:
Jacko comes down in force and leathers into us over the wadi. All turn out. Wireless leaves in 17 minutes from alarm. 

 return 11 pm.
Entry.199: Jacko back again in his place. Mail in.
Entry.200:
Two bedouins report Jacko evacuating Beersheba. Stunt on and Jacko found still there and 
occup
 waiting for us. Bad look out for the Bedouins
Entry.201: applications open for A.F.C. as pilots. Eighty applicants and all knocked back by a dirty point in no medical history being presented since none were asked for.
Entry.202:
Crime out for losing a sheet of 700 code.

Nothing doing.
Entry.203:
-

Set out 5 PM with W1 W/T Station for
Entry.204: Brigade. 10.30 PM in full moon set out with C squadron
Entry.205: Regt for outpost. Arrive Khalassa – about 7 miles SW of Beersheba at 4 am
Entry.206: Engage 16 enemy patrol and capture three. Remain all day in waiting and engage Bedouins camelry capturing 21 men – 9 camels & 3 donkeys. Move back at dusk & lose Bunker & Burchell together with water bottles.
Entry.207: Hot as hell and no water but crook stuff. Return home 10,00 arriving 5 PM.
Entry.208:
Station W2 leaves on stunt Tommy W/T stns mess up wireless messages by sending Good morning 

and other rot!
Entry.209: W2 return & we have the backsheesh job of taking them to water. Westwood goes crook and uses language.
Entry.210: Missen arrives & Long after Six months’ rest in Alex.
Entry.211: Both stations leave on a stunt
Entry.212: Stations return, have been sick for week and on sick parade.
Entry.213: Marsland sentenced to 90 days for striking Cpl Dorkins. Strike camp.
Entry.214: move to Beach near Khan Yunus.
Entry.217: Leave squadron for Australian Pack Wireless – Desert Mounted Corps. Eric also going to the AIF Cable Section. Arrive 3 P.M. at Beni Sela camp in a little cactus hedged compound.
Entry.219: Leave Beni Sela for camp about mile to east.
Entry.220: Move out to aerodrome on beach side. Half an hours work on set with plane and then dismantle. Go to Concert in YMCA & see Capt Downing later.
Entry.222: Go to AO Cable Section & see the long wave valves in work.
Entry.224: Fitch Wright get caught in Khan Yunus by the Algerians.
Entry.225: W.3 erected for practice purposes between 8 & 10 a.m.
Entry.227: Leave 7 am for Sig Sqdron – New division, not AMD. 1 PM set out for Rashid bek watering at Essani. Spend the night at Rashid bek &
Entry.228: move out ½ mile with trench sets. Fool about all day. Return at 5 PM and hit Fara 11 PM, and stay the night. Return 7 am.
Entry.229: to Beni Sela. Professor Radium has no water for 52 hours & won’t drink.
Entry.230: Albatross scout brought down by us.
Entry.231: Simp & W5 leave for Sheelel for anti aircraft warnings.
Entry.232: Canadian bus knocks a Hun from 10,000 feet.
Entry.233: Reg & I go out to see it 5 am & find canvas for bivvy
Entry.235: Move out 11 am and water at Yamli. Reach Esani at 9 PM in heavy rain storm.
Entry.237: Leave 5 AM and arrive Khalasa 11 am. Leave 3PM Arriving ASLUJ 7 PM in full moonlight (This sight is one not to be forgotten. The little white mosque and the buildings and long white water troughs set amongst the hills made the little once Turkish frontier police town look like a little fairy city from a distance).
Entry.238:
leave 10 am and reach Asluj railway station passing destroyed culvert 6:30 pm Set out in awful dust and crowd of LH and transport. 

arrive crossroads 2 am
Entry.239: and erect station. Moonlight and all very quiet. Trouble with engine. Leave at noon and arrive at point 8 miles from Bel Beersheba between the hills 6 PM just as all troops are together in a mass, two hostiles appear and bomb and m-gun. Awful casualties. 1st Bde transport almost wiped out. (Campbell of Rookwood hit whilst coming past our station). Bright moonlight. 10 PM last wounded man leaves.
Entry.240: Daybreak bomb & m-guns again. Leave 7 am and arrive Beersheba 10 am. 1500 prisoners and 16 guns taken by us. Dusk – bombs again.
Entry.241: Dirty dusty day. Go for ride around town but it is unsafe to touch anything owing to trip mines and set bombs. Dusk – bombs again.
Entry.242: another dirty day. Bombs at daybreak.
Entry.245: Fighting for wells around Beersheba. NZ horses brought in 15 miles for water. 11 PM move out and wait up in Beersheba town. Everything quiet & moonlight and very dusty, midnight leave with HQ.
Entry.246: Arrive near Sharia 5 am erected noon. Shelling with shrap. Gaza falls.
Entry.248:
am move out passing Shana rwy Stn the grain sheds and amm-dump 24 miles circling around the 

country. Erect 3 PM move off Camp at 7 PM with bde on outside HUJ.
Entry.249: Move off, 6 am arrive Huj 8 am, erect station and leave again 3 PM water midnight. Johnston thrown & kicked so placed in limber. Stumbling over waddis and rough country.
Entry.250: Match famine. Arrive Hill 331 at 9 am. 120 enemy brought in. Terrific thunderstorm at night – gloriously wet & no shelter. Sig struck dead by lightning.
Entry.251: Heavy shelling 16 allied planes bomb Jacko returning.
Entry.252:
Big attack at dusk.

13th

Water Medjel. 6 am leave 331 11.30 am through Juli’s and erect at Suffrie Gabri – Hill 154 at 2.30 PM stay night.
Entry.253: Leave 1 PM and gallop through Beit Duras, Esdud Burkah, Beshit and arrive Yebna 6 PM as fresh as a bad oyster. After a hell of a rough ride. Engine peters out with the rough trip.
Entry.254: Camel W/T take over while we repair the engine.
Entry.255: Leave Yeknah 10.30 am and Reg & I gallop to Devan and meet Freda. Give kiddies rides up the street. Change engines with W8. Engine peters out.
Entry.257: London W/T arrive terrific thunderstorm at night. Done up and wet through.
Entry.258: Close down 8 am. W9 take over raining all night. Wet and irritable.
Entry.259: Raining like hell all day. W4 arrive.
Entry.260: Cable section in. Take over from W9. 10 am. Engine breaks down 7 PM. Col. Bidder goes mad because we cannot repair it. Heavy fighting over towards Jerusalem.
Entry.261: W9 take over again. Move off noon, through Ramleh arrive Tahta, passing dead men & animals at 7 PM.
Entry.265:
Jacko opens fire.
 No tobacco & food runs out. Things very bum.
Entry.266: Jacko opens attack 6 am in massed formation but failed.
Entry.267:
Bullets & shells thick and position untenable. JC Tilson looks for VC. W3 move just in time to miss being blown to bits. Retire after abandoning limber over the hills to a valley. Fulwood Croasdale & self guard on wagons till sunset. Universal shells play hell. Dead horses & animals everywhere. A dreary sight in the valley. Animals struggling for life. Shells everywhere. Tom Massey gets bullet through saddle. Victor Goss’s mule shot dead. Bullets thick where we are hiding down the valley. Tired and hungry. Move off 10 PM along stony track. Infantry arrive. 4th Bde up and horses returned. Tommies

retire before line taken over. Guns line ridges with open sights & shells set for point blank fire. Arrive Beit Sira midnight.
Entry.268: Artillery moving up. Grand artillery scene 22 guns blazing continuously. Scotties arrive.
Entry.269: Move off noon but turned back by shells. Arrive Annabel 4 PM camp over night in gully alongside dead men & animals. Wounded and maimed Tommies on the way back pass us. Everyone done up.
Entry.275: Rain & cold. Limber to Gaza for gear.
Entry.276: Rain. Massey, Tricnell Kenny to W4 at Enab.
Entry.278:
Jerusalem falls. 

A bitterly cold day. Wet through and done up. 

 

Deiran
Entry.279: Pack up and leave camp with HQ men and proceed to Latron.
Entry.280: Leave 7 am and proceed. Wagon nearly lost near Motza through break giving way. Arrive Jerus 5 pm and meet Kenny & . Arrive Bethlehem 6 PM and camp in an old Greek Monastry.
Entry.282: Pack up ready to move out.
Entry.283: Leave Bethlehem 10 am with pack animals and have a very rough trip through the narrow streets. Crowds of people line the way. Wind up and down the bridle path and eventually get a glimpse of Jerusalem over all the rough country. Awful rocky country having to lead the animals most of the way. Have lunch 3 PM in a little grassy patch & move on and at dark camp up on the hill overlooking the Dead Sea.
Entry.284:
3 am move on again in rain and wind up and down, reaching the flats near a big redoubt which is being shelled heavily. Spread out and get across as quickly as possible. Hide under cover of the redoubt all day and get the wind up over a few close shots. Erect station at dark and do some traffic. Men set out 

(No water and all parched and thirsty) to find water returning 3 am
Entry.285: Stand to 3.30 am and move out to Sqn being met by Sturman. Return to redoubt and erect doing good work. Move off and again wind in and out the deep gorges and bridle paths. Have some stiff climbing to do. Water scarce. Raining. Arrive at end of Judean Hills and look down over the Dead Sea and plains of Jericho. Wind down on the plain and set out for Jehrico. Turks shelling the horses from the other side of the Jordan. Five Taubs appear low down and evidently intend bombing but when scattered as we soon did his mark disappears and they go away & return and we again scatter. Water in a lovely stream of water and have a big drink. Move on to NZMR and erect for press only. Turks shelling all day. Tired out and very sleepy we retire to our bivvies made of any old thing to be found. I make one of two sheet iron just big enough for one.
Entry.286: Out taking few photos down a creek. Raining intermittently and windy. Bread issue so soon. Beautiful view over plains Jehrico Jordan and Mts of Moab.
Entry.287:
leave Jehrico 6 PM and return via the Jehrico Jerus road. A long dreary ride. Road blown to bits in places. Ascend steadily 

and at the top – in full moon – pass part of the 60th Div who are singing "When v come to the end" etc. They give 3 cheers for "the dinkums" and swarm over to us as we wind upwards – a long stream of horsemen reaching for miles. Very cold here and misty.
Entry.288: 1am draw up in valley and draw rations. 2am proceed and arrive Jerus as the bells strike 3 am. Bitterly cold wet & muddy. Everyone frozen stiff. Making the pace – a welter passing. Calvary Damascus Gate & thence via Jaffa gate. Arrive Bethlehem 5 am wet and muddy. Have a sup of tea and at 8 am turn in.
Entry.289: Pack up ready to leave and at last min orders cancelled.
Entry.291: Leave 9 am and continue past Junction Station and through AKIR and on to Deiran.
Entry.292: JC Tetson to Cairo on leave.
Entry.293: Practice stunt to Yebra, all aboard the carts. A bum turn out.
Entry.295: CS backsheesh arrive. W5 move out to NZMR. HQ & I move over to AIF cable.
Entry.296: Move out and camp at Lavron.
Entry.297: On to Jerusalem arriving 1700 and camp in Section Camp.
Entry.300: Pack up 3 PM in rain and mud and W4 leaves for Jehrico. HQ & I follow 4PM. Arrive at W4 at the cross roads on Jehrico road 1 am.
Entry.301:
Roads all blocked and muddy Raining at night. 

18th-19th-20th 

Missen & Goss return from leave.
Entry.302: Leave Cross roads 2 PM for Jehrico, arriving 8 PM. Pass down plain and through town. Great traffic and pontoons on their way to the Jordan.
Entry.304: am arrive at point down the wadi bed near Jordan. Turks open fire with m.guns and rifles from opposite bank. Shelled during morning. Move off 10 am back over the plain and down alongside running water and camp, beautiful calm night.
Entry.305: Move on past Gilgal and alongside the wadi. Lads spend afternoon fishing. Move off 9 pm and Cross the Jordan 5 PM over pontoon ground very soft and boggy. Arrive at Teh Nimson 9 PM and camp overnight.
Entry.306: Move at dawn and camp farther up wadi. Jacko shells and we have to move. Hide in gully of fleas etc. Move slowly forward while Jacko shells the infantry advancing over the plain. Arrive at point up the wadi at 3 PM and camp on the grass. Raining. Bob Jones almost gets a Jacko.
Entry.307:
Move off dawn and advance by slow stages and then onwards towards ES . Terrific rocky country, horses slipping and sliding and stumbling over the rocks. Raining most of the time. Erect at 10 am-12 noon. Also 4.30 to 5 PM. Some wild ascents. Bitterly cold and raining on the hill tops. Magnificent view over Jordan valley. 

Jehrico, Dead Sea and Jerusalem visible in the distance. Arrive ES SALT at 12 midnight.
Entry.308: Raining all night. Sleeping with Lanyon, Wet through. Muddy and sloppy camping ground. Sun shines. Leave at 9 PM just as we intend having a good sleep and after erecting a bivvy. Pass through Es Salt at 10.30 PM and water at a trough opposite Turkish hospital. Take road and pass EAL and cable wagon returning. Arrive 181st Bde (inf.) midnight and turn in.
Entry.309:
Reveille 4 am and out along the track. Enemy transport animals dead all the way. Two enemy planes machine gun column from very low height. Twenty five motor transport wagons and 5 motor cars of the enemy left on the road. Motor workshop and other car destroyed before his retreat. Tribal war going on between Christian villagers and Circassians - inclined towards Turks – NZ Sqdn stop them. "Christians" loot the Circassian village. Camp over night. 

28th

3 women killed in the tribal scrap. Continue the march and at noon erect. Great fight going on and our advance held up. 7th LH badly knocked about. Freddy Honstone passes at night. Fred Pierce wounded. (AMMAN)
Entry.310:
have only 65 rifles left. 

More rafts and artillery sent for. Attack at night.
Entry.311: Holding on. Enemy’s retreat cut off north and South of AMMAN.
Entry.312: Enemy begins shelling heavily. Still holding on but not gaining much. Heavy casualties, raining all day. Mountain battery versus mountain battery and some heavy stuff from enemy. Pack up at 10 PM and retire 1000 yds. Cold night.
Entry.313: Enemy shells the road heavily and causes 20 casualties. Iron flying thickly. All move back and take road to Shweilah and then another track leading to AIN SIR where we arrive in heavy rain. Camp. Pitch dark night raining and cold. A cruel night. No rations.
Entry.314: Up 1 am enemy reported advancing and threatening to cut us off. Bitterly cold and blowing a gale. Held up on the road for hour or two and do a perish. Enemy advances on us. Retire through SIR and along wadi banks and erect at 10.30 am. Down Stn noon and move 500 yds & erect. Retire with rearguard at 6.30 PM over a bridle track. Delayed two hours in cold by camel transport on the muddy path. Cold and very sleepy we travel all night and at
Entry.315:
5 am arrive at BHQ on the plains. 12 enemy planes bomb. One hour’s sleep and on again at 1.30 PM. Many refugees 

from ES Salt and other villages follow us to get away from the Turks. Little kiddies and sick all in the stream. Cross the Jordan at 3 PM and move up on the plains near Jehrico and camp. Lovely view over the Mts of Moab at night & sunset.
Entry.316: 12 planes bomb the plain. Nice and warm. down on the Jordan taking photos. Leave the plains and return to Tell et Dumm dump.
Entry.317:
Go down wadi Kelt taking photos – a 
nice
 little walk.
Entry.318: pack up and leave for Jerusalem. Rains as soon as we arrive.
Entry.319:
Out taking photos
 W4 leave for Jaffa.
Entry.320: out taking photos on Mt of Olives.
Entry.321: Visit to the Old City but taken bad and have to return.
Entry.322: Tom Cox to hospital with eyes.
Entry.323: To Jehrico with Jim. Stay night at W5 on the plains.
Entry.324: Cross Jordan to W3 stay night.
Entry.325: return to Jerusalem with new horse. Give Teedy to Jones.
Entry.331: Jim Tilson returns. Paddy Whelan shot through foot
Entry.334:
the Yids Clara & other girl for 19/- worth 

of eggs – 57-
Entry.335: leave Jerusalem fro Telat-ed-Dumm arriving three PM. Feeling seedy.
Entry.336: W4 now W08 to Aust Division. Two refts arrive.
Entry.337: leave Talat-ed-Dumm for Jehrico and camp down near Jordan
Entry.338: Move up to Des Corps. Five drivers arrive.
Entry.339: Lucas & Trevathen to W08 who have a breakdown heavy shelling on both sides. Ride up to Mt. of Temptation.
Entry.340:
Brigades begin to 
. 9 guns lost and
Entry.341:
Bde Field Ambulance. 

4th

Lucas and Trevethan return.
Entry.343: Visit W3 and get particulars of requirements for set.
Entry.344: Shift camp up to the town of Jehrico. W3 & W5 called in.
Entry.346:
drop 3.8 bombs lively time.

9th

3 hostiles bomb
Entry.347: All quiet altho’ we take no risks with the early visit of Jacko.
Entry.349:
years
 old. Hell of a day. Visit mons quarantine

12-13-14-15

Hellish hot days.
Entry.350: report sick & evacuated with Pyrexia. Motor to Aust CCS and then by van to 65th CCS Jerus.
Entry.351: leave Jerico and arrive 26th CCS Ludd
Entry.354: Leave Ludd for Gaza arriving 47th Stationary hospital 3 pm "B" ward – bed 41
Entry.355: Fire breaks out in "C" ward destroying tent.
Entry.356: Leave at 8 am for Kantara arriving 44th Statn. at 4 PM. Nice little Sister in ward (F2). – bed 11.
Entry.357: To a concert by the Bats at night.
Entry.358: To the RAMC Concert at night.
Entry.359: move to 31st Gen Abbasia and put in D3 ward – bed 54.
Entry.362: Concert at night. All leave before first act.
Entry.365:
for Bulac Convalescent. 

31st

Having excellent time. Go to Cairo and meet Bob Stinson & Branston
Entry.366: Meet Harvey (Fritz) Rostran in Ezbekia. (Continental Photo stores Madamoiselle)
Entry.367: Cairo again and to the Citadel
Entry.369: do and though Moueky St Bazaars.
